text: SPIES formed by Stan Schwalger; Support from Tyrone Newson and Chris Southern, Dean and Liz Godfrey
Given Desk and Phone use on the 6th floor
Mentoring Partnerships Formed
First SPIES T-SHIRTS Printed
The first SPIES office was windowless partition on the 3rd floor corridor with one key
Kepa meets Calvin Bland (President) while climbing over the walls to get into the room
SPIES, AUES and WEN invited to attend faculty
The Tuakana mentoring and tutoring programs were initiated
Kepa contracted for 15 hours a week to lecture and manage and plan faculty's M훮ori and Pasifika initiatives
The first 'Annual Retreat' was held in Rotoiti, Rotorua

SPIES' first 'Common Room'. The 'Common Room' was imperative in establishing a sense of community. After the removal of the common lunch hour, VSM (Voluntary Student Membership) meant that funding for SPIES form AUES was not available
M훮ori and Pasifika students from High School were invited into the Engineering School
Indigenous E-Day
SPIES' first 'Winter Retreat'
The creation of three part time positions centred around M훮ori and Pasifika equity; positions filled by Arahia, Manu, and Chris
The creation of an Associate Dean M훮ori position; position filled by Kepa
Celebrated ten years of SPIES with a large Annual Dinner and speech by the Ipenz President
The First Performance of the SPIES Haka
Veronica Maka employed as Pasifika Mentor

Following discussions at the Anniversary Dinner a society was formed to promore the practice of indigenous engineers in the South Pacific; The society named themselves: SPEEX (South Pacific Professional Engineering Excellence) or Te Moana Nui A Kiwa Whakapukahatanga Ihi
The painting Karanga By Hinerangitoariari (Winifred Belcher) was installed on the 3rd floor
SPIES awarded Australasian Association of Engineering Education Award for 'Excellence in Inclusivity'
SPIES Pacific Tours (Fiji/Tonga) - A tour of 22 students and 3 staff conducted tertiary education seminars at 5 schools, visted several engineering sites, and attended 2 alumni functions
The appointment of Marcia, Pat and Stu as the Maori External Liaison, Maori Student Mentor & Pasifika Student Mentor
133 Maori/Pasifika students enrolled in Engineering; half of these are active members
Pacific Tour to Samoa
Jim Peters, Vice Chancellor for Maori, organised funding for SPIES students through the university for the personal and professional development of students
30 Year Anniversary of the Haka Party
Visit from He Taua who were key drivers in eliminating the Haka Party and were arrested for confronting the engineers who took part
Marcia's Last Year
SPPEEX role started in SPIES executive team

SPIES Pacific Tour to Fiji, Tonga and Samoa. Visted 15 Schools. Presented Workshops promoting engineering and the University of Auckland. Presented at the Inigenous Engineering Symposium (Conference in Samoa)
Dennis Matene appointed as the Kaiarahi
Structural changes promoted growth within the association and autonomy of the SPIES executive leadership team
Dennis and Steve took over MAPTES

The initiation of Outreach Programmes in schools which saw a 400% increase in enrolments of Maori and Pacific students through the MAPTES programme. The next three years saw an 89% completion rate of MAPTES students from year 1 to year 2
The election of SPIES first Co-Presidents
SPIES 21st Birthday Celebrated at the Annual Dinner
Transpower became the First industry Sponsor of SPIES
The introduction of the public relation role on the SPIES executive leadership team
Catherine Dunphy appointed as the Kaiarahi
The SPIES common room reallocated to HSB due to construction of new engineering faciliities
SPIES Celebrates 30th Anniversary at Annual Dinner
Won 3 UOA Club Awards: Best in Engineering, Academic Club of The Year, Supreme Club of The Year
